subject: p12433421
Impression: AP chest compared to : Mild pulmonary edema is new. Opacification of the base of the left lung, accompanied by elevation of the left hemidiaphragm is substantially atelectasis, now accompanied by small pleural effusion. Followup advised to exclude developing pneumonia in this location from presumed aspiration. Heart size is normal. No pneumothorax. Right jugular line ends in the SVC.
